definition[0]: to leave a place, especially when this is not easy
example[0]: The meeting dragged on, and I didn’t get away until seven.
example[1]: I like to get away from London at the weekend.
definition[1]: to take a holiday away from the place you normally live
example[2]: Will you manage to get away this summer?
example[3]: We’re hoping to get away to Scotland for a few days.
definition[2]: to escape from someone who is chasing you or trying to catch you
example[4]: The three men got away in a stolen car.
example[5]: We knew it wouldn’t be easy to get away from the police.
example[6]: The thieves got away with jewellery worth over £50,000.
definition[3]: used to say you are very surprised by something or do not believe it
definition[4]: something good that you nearly had or that nearly happened
